This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest floors or along streams. Its structure consists of a leafy thallus that is often carpet-like in appearance, with intricate branching patterns. Deckera sulphurea plays a vital ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its native habitats.
